title: The Primus is the standard radar installed in the Learjet It…
caption_en: The Primus is the standard radar installed in the Learjet It is an X-band radar system designed for atmospheric moisture detection and ground mapping.

title: When the system is in weather detection mode, it will detect…
caption_en: When the system is in weather detection mode, it will detect and locate various types of inclement weather conditions along the flight path and provide a visual-colour display of storm intensities.

title: When the system is used for ground mapping, the display will…
caption_en: When the system is used for ground mapping, the display will enable crew to identify coastlines, hilly or mountainous regions, cities, or large structures.

title: The weather radar system consists of a RTA unit which stands…
caption_en: The weather radar system consists of a RTA unit which stands for receivertransmitterantenna and a weather radar controller. The RTA is a 12-inch plate and is installed inside the radome on the forward side of the frame. The weather radar controller is mounted on the pedestal.

title: The radar antenna is provided with pitch and roll signals to…
caption_en: The radar antenna is provided with pitch and roll signals to stabilise the antenna. The antenna receives stabilization inputs from AHRS 1.

title: The RTA transmits and receives X-band radio frequency energy…
caption_en: The RTA transmits and receives X-band radio frequency energy. The transmitter sent signals to the antenna; the antenna scans and directs signals to any targets that fall within the scanning sector.

title: When the radar beam hits a target, part of the beam is defle…
caption_en: When the radar beam hits a target, part of the beam is deflected back and is received by the antenna; and part of it continues forward to detect any targets further down. The echoed signal, which is received by the antenna, now goes to the receiver.

title: The receiver and processing system processes and convert thi…
caption_en: The receiver and processing system processes and convert this signal to video data. The video data is then transmitted directly to PFDs and instead of being channelled to symbol generators. This is due to RTA ability to convert signals straight to video

title: To display weather on the compass format must be in partial …
caption_en: To display weather on the compass format must be in partial compass (ARC) or map. And on the the compass must be in the map mode.

caption_en: Selection of weather display on the is by WX button on the display controller. On the selection of weather display is by WX menu button on the bezel controller.

caption_en: When (standby) is selected, the RTA is powered up but it does not radiate any RF energy and antenna does not scan. The system performs a magnetron warm up for about 45 seconds. During this time, WAIT is annuncicted on the and in cyan.

title: If the aircraft is on the ground, system will go into forced…
caption_en: If the aircraft is on the ground, system will go into forced standby (F mode after 45 seconds has elapsed. The forced standby is a feacture designed to prevent radar from switching on to an operating mode while aircraft is on the ground.

title: If the aircraft is in the air and is selected, will be annun…
caption_en: If the aircraft is in the air and is selected, will be annunciated after the warm up period is over. In this mode, antenna does not scan, transmitter is disabled, the display memory is erased, and antenna is stowed in a tilt-up position. Standby should be selected anytime it is desired to keep power on the system without transmitting.

caption_en: Storm intensity levels are displayed in four standard colours in the WX mode. Areas of heaviest rainfall appear in magenta, next heaviest is red, rainfall of medium intensity in yellow, and areas of weak rainfall appear in green.

title: In the ground mapping mode, the system internal parameters a…
caption_en: In the ground mapping mode, the system internal parameters are set to enhance returns from the ground targets and reduce returns from weather targets. In this mode, prominent landmarks are displayed which enable the pilot to identify coastlines, mountainous regions, cities and even large structure.

title: The colour scheme in use when in GMAP mode are cyan, yellow …
caption_en: The colour scheme in use when in GMAP mode are cyan, yellow and magenta. Cyan represents the least reflective return, yellow is a moderate return and magenta is a strong return.

title: Because GMAP has its own set of colours for interpretation, …
caption_en: Because GMAP has its own set of colours for interpretation, pilot should not attempt to use GMAP for weather detection. Weather type targets are not calibrated when the radar is in GMAP mode.

title: If the test is not normal, FAIL will be annunciated in amber…
caption_en: If the test is not normal, FAIL will be annunciated in amber and a fault code appears below the annunciation. Fault code should be given to the maintanence crew for trouble-shooting.

caption_en: When the selector is pushed down, it returns to preset mode. In the preset mode, there is no annunciation. The system is in fully automatic gain control in this mode. It is also the recommended setting for WX mode.

title: In an operation without REACT, the X-band energy transmitted…
caption_en: In an operation without REACT, the X-band energy transmitted by the antenna will deflect a certain signals back to the receiver which convert signal into visual images on the and The returned signals from the first target are strong, but the returned signals from the subsequent targets are weaker (attenuate).

title: When viewed on the screen, the targets do not depict the act…
caption_en: When viewed on the screen, the targets do not depict the actual intensity of clouds that are ahead of the aircaft.

title: When REACT is selected, the radar receiver sensitivity is in…
caption_en: When REACT is selected, the radar receiver sensitivity is increased and this will compensate for the attenuation losses as the radar pulse passes through weather targets on its way to illuminate other targets. The compensated targets when displayed on the screen will reflect the true status of the clouds ahead.

title: There is a maximum value to which sensitivity may be set due…
caption_en: There is a maximum value to which sensitivity may be set due to the receiver generating noise, and fills the display with noise if it were too high.When this maximum value is reached a blue colour is displayed for the remainder of the displayed range. This gives the crew an unmistakable warning that attenuation is hiding severe weather (magenta level) that cannot be accurately detected.
